Adventure Features: Safari tents, domes, pods, river swimming, onsite pub
description: Fforest Farm is the ultimate glamping experience for adventure travelers. Located near the Teifi Marshes and the coast, it offers a range of unique accommodation from geodesic domes to bell tents. It's a place to reconnect with nature without sacrificing comfort.
adventure_friendly: On-site outdoor activities, river access for swimming/canoeing, bike storage.
proximity: Close to Cardigan Bay coast path and kayaking spots.

description: Under the Thatch offers a curated collection of unique stays across Wales, from restored historic cottages to luxury yurts. Perfect for those seeking character and a connection to Welsh heritage.
adventure_friendly: Remote locations, unique features, often near hiking trails.
proximity: Locations vary, many near coast and national parks.

Adventure Features: Yurts, bell tents, caban, estuary views
description: Graig Wen offers award-winning glamping with stunning views over the Mawddach Estuary. Stay in yurts, bell tents, or a cozy caban, all situated in a wild and beautiful setting.
adventure_friendly: Direct access to Mawddach Trail, secure bike storage, drying facilities.
proximity: Direct access to Mawddach Trail, near Cader Idris and Coed y Brenin.

Adventure Features: Off-grid, renewable energy, remote mountain location
description: Eco-lodges offering a peaceful basecamp in the heart of Snowdonia. Perfect for unwinding after adventure, these lodges are off-grid and powered by renewable energy.
adventure_friendly: Secure bike storage, drying room, packed lunches available.
proximity: 15 min drive to Zip World Velocity 2, near Snowdon trails.

Adventure Features: Beach huts, art trail, National Trust
description: These glamping pods on the Llŷn Peninsula offer a comfortable basecamp for exploring the Welsh coast. Forget cramped tents; these pods provide a warm, dry space to recover after a day of adrenaline-fueled activities.
adventure_friendly: Outdoor gear storage, communal drying area, access to coastal path.
proximity: Short drive to surf breaks and coasteering spots.

Adventure Features: Luxury glamping tents, sea views, near beach
description: Campsite with luxury glamping options overlooking Three Cliffs Bay. Immerse in nature with comfort in their bell tents or yurts.
adventure_friendly: Gear storage, drying lines, easy access to beach.
proximity: Short walk to beach, near climbing spots and Gower Way.

description: Stay right in the heart of the action at Zip World Fforest. Safari tents and pods available surrounded by woodland adventures.
adventure_friendly: On-site Zip Safari, Fforest Coaster, bike storage nearby.
proximity: On-site at Zip World Fforest, near Betws-y-Coed.

Adventure Features: Camping pods, indoor climbing, horse riding
description: Camping pods located at Wales' premier multi-activity centre. A perfect simple base for climbing, riding, and exploring the Brecon Beacons.
adventure_friendly: On-site activities, drying room, bike wash.
proximity: On-site climbing and riding, near Llangorse Lake.

description: Tranquil eco-lodge basecamp for exploring Pembrokeshire coast. Sustainable accommodation with a focus on outdoor activities.
adventure_friendly: Drying room, bike storage, equipment storage, on-site activities.
proximity: Near coasteering and kayaking spots, close to coast path.

description: Magical treehouse holidays in a hidden valley in Mid Wales. Disconnect and immerse in nature in these beautifully crafted structures.
adventure_friendly: Remote location, wood-burners, near hiking trails.
proximity: Near Dyfi Forest MTB trails and Cader Idris.

Adventure Features: Suspended tree tent, private stream, fire pit
description: Unique spherical tree tent suspended in the canopy. Featured on George Clarke's Amazing Spaces, this is a truly unique stay.
adventure_friendly: Private, secluded, outdoor cooking, nature immersion.
proximity: Near Elan Valley and Wye Valley Walk.

Adventure Features: Yurts, treehouses, hobbit houses, hot tubs
description: Luxury glamping village with hot tubs, just outside Tenby. Offers a variety of unique structures from hobbit houses to treehouses.
adventure_friendly: Hot tubs, fishing lake, near beaches.
proximity: Short drive to Tenby beaches and activities.

Adventure Features: Geodesic domes, farm setting, mountain views
description: Luxury glamping domes on a working farm on the Llŷn Peninsula. Enjoy panoramic views of the mountains and coast.
adventure_friendly: Hot tubs, dark skies, space for gear.
proximity: Near Llŷn Peninsula beaches and Snowdonia.

description: Peaceful woodland glamping in the Wye Valley. Choose from pods or treehouses nestled in the trees.
adventure_friendly: Woodland walks, bike storage, fire pits.
proximity: Near Wye Valley activities and Royal Welsh Showground.

Adventure Features: Yurts, domes, UFO, Jet Star plane
description: Quirky glamping site featuring a UFO and a Jet Star plane. A fun and unique base for Pembrokeshire adventures.
adventure_friendly: Unique themed accommodation, communal facilities.
proximity: Near Tenby and Saundersfoot.

description: Eco-friendly glamping domes in a woodland setting near the Brecon Beacons. Stylish and sustainable with wood-fired hot tubs.
adventure_friendly: Wood-fired hot tubs, communal kitchen, hammock circle.
proximity: Near Hay-on-Wye and Black Mountains.

description: Comfortable glamping cabins on a working farm in the Cambrian Mountains. Great access to local trails and reservoirs.
adventure_friendly: Bike wash, drying room, fire pits.
proximity: Near Hafren Forest and Clywedog Reservoir.

Adventure Features: Luxury cabins, hot tubs, forest setting
description: Luxury cabins set deep within Beddgelert Forest. A perfect blend of comfort and nature in the National Park.
adventure_friendly: Hot tubs, forest ranger activities, bike hire nearby.
proximity: In Snowdonia National Park, near hiking trails.

description: Simple camping pods located within walking distance of Betws-y-Coed. An affordable and convenient base for Snowdonia.
adventure_friendly: Basic facilities, near village amenities.
proximity: In Betws-y-Coed, adventure hub.

description: Luxury glamping lodges situated at Llechwedd Slate Caverns. Experience the history and adventure of the slate mines.
adventure_friendly: Views of quarry, near Zip World, comfortable beds.
proximity: On-site at Zip World Llechwedd.

Adventure Features: Safari lodges, pioneer camps, meadow camping
description: Eco-luxury glamping and camping in Pembrokeshire National Park. Spacious sites with a focus on nature connection.
adventure_friendly: Nature connection, dark skies, campfire cooking.
proximity: Near Cenarth Falls and Cardigan.

description: Historic luxury hotel near Bala, perfect for a high-end adventure base. Experience Victorian grandeur in Snowdonia.
adventure_friendly: Fine dining, drying room, concierge for activities.
proximity: Near Bala Lake and Snowdonia activities.

description: Stay in the unique Italianate village of Portmeirion. A surreal and beautiful location for a unique Welsh holiday.
adventure_friendly: Architecture, gardens, spa, woodland walks.
proximity: Near Snowdonia attractions.

description: Stylish self-catering accommodation in a converted laundry. High-end finish with practical features for active guests.
adventure_friendly: Bike storage, drying room, boot room.
proximity: Near Brecon Beacons trails.

description: Stay at the National Outdoor Centre, a hub for serious adventurers. Simple, functional, and steeped in climbing history.
adventure_friendly: Drying room, equipment hire, bar, expert advice.
proximity: Central Snowdonia location.

description: Accommodation at the National Watersports Centre. Wake up right next to the Menai Strait ready for action.
adventure_friendly: Watersports access, drying room, equipment hire.
proximity: On the Menai Strait.

description: Unique hotel located within the ruins of a 12th-century priory. A truly atmospheric place to stay in the Black Mountains.
adventure_friendly: Historic setting, remote, dark skies.
proximity: In the Black Mountains, Offa's Dyke nearby.

description: Stay in a historic castle in the Brecon Beacons. Former home of Adelina Patti, with ghost tours and history.
adventure_friendly: Ghost tours, history, dog friendly.
proximity: Near Dan yr Ogof caves.

description: Luxury accommodation in a restored Norman castle. Panoramic views over Pembrokeshire from the battlements.
adventure_friendly: Panoramic views, luxury amenities, historic.
proximity: Near St Davids and coast.

description: Stay in a real castle for a budget price. A moated Norman castle used as a youth hostel.
adventure_friendly: Historic, communal, cycle storage.
proximity: In the Wye Valley/Forest of Dean.

Adventure Features: Pub with rooms on the beach
description: Iconic pub located directly on the beach at Porthdinllaen. Access by foot or golf course only, adding to the seclusion.
adventure_friendly: Beachfront, pub atmosphere, car-free access.
proximity: On the beach, near Nefyn.
